title: How to Make a Steak
steps: Make a simple grilling marinade.

title: How to Pair Wine with Grilled Steak
steps: Drink dry wines with steak.
Bring out herb flavors with a Bordeaux.
Match the savory flavors in beef with a Malbec.
Accentuate sweet and/or spicy flavors with a Zinfandel.
Pair with a dry riesling when you can't settle on a vintage.
Select your wine according to how well done the meat is.

title: How to Grill Steak
steps: Use a dry rub or seasoning instead of straight salt and pepper.
Try out a wet marinade for a softer, more-flavorful steak.
Slather your steak with a pat of butter for a rich steakhouse meal.
Top your steak with something special to make a meal of it.

title: How to Grill Sirloin Steak
steps: Rub a seasoning over the meat in place of salt and pepper.

Top your steak.

title: How to Make Steak Rub
steps: Place all of the ingredients into a mixing bowl.
Mix to combine thoroughly.

title: How to Tell if Steak Is Done
steps: Cut into the thickest part of the steak to check the color inside.
Check the doneness of your steak using the finger test.
Compare the firmness of the steak to various parts of your face to estimate doneness.
Use size as an indicator of whether your steak is done.

title: How to Apply a Steak Rub
steps: Choose a steak to grill.
Find a rub recipe from a cookbook or online.
Make the rub.
Apply the rub to the steak.
Let the steak rest.
Grill the steak.
Finished.

title: How to Cook Kangaroo Steak
steps: Rub herbs and spices into your steak for taste.
Submerge your steak in a flavored liquid.
Place your kangaroo steak in a plastic or glass bowl and cover it with plastic wrap.
Place your steak in the fridge and let it marinate overnight.
